title: Is filing for bankruptcy right for me?
question: Contemplating on filing for bankruptcy due to covid my finances have become overwhelming. Need some assistance to determine if this is the right direction to take.
answers:
We don't recommend bankruptcy unless you owe more then 20% of your yearly income. If you do owe that much, call a local bk lawyer.

d

Contact a bankruptcy lawyer asap so you can determine if bankruptcy is the right option. Your entire financial picture has to be reviewed before a bankruptcy recommendation can be made. Many of us here on AVVO offer free consultations. Take us up on it, it's free.

You will need to provide additional information about your income, assets, debts, and expenses in order to get an analysis of your qualification. As my colleagues states most bankruptcy attorneys provide a free consultation.

Most bankruptcy attorneys will provide a free consultation. Without more information, there is no way for the people in this forum can tell you if bankruptcy is a good fit for you. I strongly suggest finding a local attorney to assist you.
Consultation with lawyers directly on your situation is generally free. Find a lawyer near you where you can talk comprehensively regarding your situation to determine if it is right for you.

Without more information it’s impossible to say at this point. I recommend you consult with a local bankruptcy attorney. Most will give you a free consultation. The fact that you are thinking about it says you are more than just a little worried about your financial situation. Some debts are not dischargable in bankruptcy, while others can be totally eliminated. Bankruptcy can restore a sense of peace of mind to your life again, but You really got to talk one on one with an attorney
